element.name: Stella's Place by Windsockers, Traditional Cache (1.5/1)

long-description.p: The ruins of St Catherine's are to be found near the gates of St Ita's Hospital. The church dates back to the Norman days. The church was built in the early 12th century. The lands of Portrane were granted to Christ Church Cathedral by Sitric the Dane in 1038 A.D. This grant was confirmed by St Laurence O Toole and is mentioned, among other possessions of Christ Church, by Pope Urban in 1186. It was once the property of the Nuns of Grace Dieu who are said to have moved there when their monastery was suppressed (1538) and they lived at Portrane until the end of the reign of Queen Elizabeth 1. High up on two sides of the tower can be seen two ugly faces. This was a very ancient custom from pre-christian times and was supposed to frighten off evil spirits.

Near the church is a Norman Peel Tower which is often called "Stella Castle" because it is said that Dean Swift's lady friend, Stella, lived there for a time in 1712. It is also said that Dean Swift visited her here.
The cache is a micro container with note pad and pencil
Please replace it with care to prevent all the young muggles who frequent this area at night from finding it.

ul.li:
2010-06-13T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by thomasvm
Didn't find it where the GPS showed it should be, reading the previous records it might be somewhere on that graveyard - hmm - might be back.

2010-05-15T19:00:00Z : Found it by Alastair74
Found with Wildfowler while spending the day in Dublin for the WWFM. TFTC

2010-05-15T19:00:00Z : Found it by wildfowler
Found on a caching weekend around Dublin with Alastair74! TNLNSL TFTC

2010-05-04T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by Geo Chief
At the given coordinates was nothing to find.
Greetings Geo Chief

2010-03-21T19:00:00Z : Found it by rooske
At long last after 5 attemps (with a little bit of help). And then is was so obvious!

wpt.name: GCZTPE
wpt.desc: Stella's Place by Windsockers, Traditional Cache (1.5/1)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Stella's Place
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
Stella's Castle

The ruins of St Catherine's are to be found near the gates of St Ita's Hospital. The church dates back to the Norman days. The church was built in the early 12th century. The lands of Portrane were granted to Christ Church Cathedral by Sitric the Dane in 1038 A.D. This grant was confirmed by St Laurence O Toole and is mentioned, among other possessions of Christ Church, by Pope Urban in 1186. It was once the property of the Nuns of Grace Dieu who are said to have moved there when their monastery was suppressed (1538) and they lived at Portrane until the end of the reign of Queen Elizabeth 1. High up on two sides of the tower can be seen two ugly faces. This was a very ancient custom from pre-christian times and was supposed to frighten off evil spirits.

Near the church is a Norman Peel Tower which is often called "Stella Castle" because it is said that Dean Swift's lady friend, Stella, lived there for a time in 1712. It is also said that Dean Swift visited her here.

The Cache

The cache is a micro container with note pad and pencil

Please replace it with care to prevent all the young muggles who frequent this area at night from finding it.


The Windsockers
